poem:
Title: Sunak, Many As Dolls Cast

A man shaped as the house of many,
Sunak, unveils himself –
a puzzle
beneath the Tories' gaze.
Within their caucus, an eternal winter,
eight autumns thick –
thrust from the womb of psychodrama.
Confusion, a familiar friend.
Ask they, who is the true -
unfamiliar in his own likeness? 

Alas! The Real is yet a stranger,
even in the mirror of the abstract.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Like Barbie, there are many Rishis. Which is the real Sunak is beyond even his supporters’ grasp | Isabel Hardman When Rishi Sunak told his MPs to unite behind him last week, many were left scratching their heads. Both the subject and object of the sentence baffled them. How was it possible for Conservative MPs to wean themselves off their addiction to psychodrama after eight straight years of it? And what, precisely, were they supposed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
